stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: Because neither of them have indicated dislike of the hairstyle, nor a preestablished dislike of the hairstyle.
Jane knows about Catherine's injury and so will understand the exaggerated enthusiasm from Catherine would be too much from someone freshly recovering from a back injury.
Jack does not know his mistake and such a response from Anastasia would seem like common courtesy.
Julia does not know about Margaret's past trauma with dogs and so the comment will seem out of place unless it was a joke.
Eric does not know that Philip dislikes his style of fashion, and as the interview went will and fashion is highly subjective Eric may just consider it a genuine compliment.
David does not know of the genuine friendship the brothers have for each other and having only seen the heated argument will not be quick to believe such a statement.
Ken has no knowledge of how they broke up and so can only take her word and may think they broke up amicably.
Elizabeth has no idea what happened to May during the trip nor her feelings throughout so Elizabeth can only take May's word for it.
